actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to limit the amount of living expenses while away from home which Members of Congress may deduct.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to limit to $9,000 the amount of living expenses which Members of Congress may deduct from their incomes. Repeals the provision allowing such tax deduction without substantiation.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to limit the amount of living expenses while away from home which Members of Congress may deduct.
